Posts.Content: I'm 43 years old and have a lump under my armpit. I'm going to the doctor's tomorrow. I have a mammogram every year. I'm due for my yearly mammogram in May. Breast cancer does not run in my family. I've checked my breast and didn't find any lumps. I'm nervous. Is it possible to get breast cancer without finding a lump in the breast but only in the armpit? I read that a lump can be from an infection such as a scratch. Can you get a lump from shaving your armpit? I never had any problems before. But then again I had my first abnormal pap (which turned out to be OK), now this. I'm really nervous. Any information will be appreciated. Thank You, Bernice
Posts.Title: Armpit

Posts.Content: Thank you for your reply. Is that a serious thing? Bernice
Posts.Title: Armpit

Posts.Content: I went to my doctor. She thinks it's a swollen lymph node. She doesn't think it's anything to worry about. She checked my breasts and didn't find anything. I'm having my yearly mammogram in May and she wants me to go back to her that week and if this lump is still there, she'll send me to a specialist and maybe have a biopsy done on it. Isn't 6 weeks too long to wait and not do anything? Is there anything I can do to help it go away? I'm not going to shave as much under my arm. I shave every other day. Maybe I'll shave once a week. She said it's like when you have a cold and the lymph nodes in your neck swells. That's just like under your arm. I really never heard that your lumph nodes under your arm can swell (causing a lump) from shaving. Anyone heard of that? I never had any problems before. I just hope this lump goes away. Bernice
Posts.Title: Armpit

Posts.Content: I went to my doctor last month because I felt a lump under my arm. She said she doesn't think it's anything to worry about and to come back for a follow up after I have my mammogram. I had my mammogram on monday and went to her today. The mammogram came back negative but the lump is still there. She said she doesn't think it's anything to worry about but she's sending me to a specialist for a second opinion. I'm a nervous wreck. Can mammograms detect lumps under to arms? These lumps don't really feel like lumps. They feel more like muscles. They're not round. They are more long (like when I press on it, I can feel it as I move my finger along my armpit. This is in both of my arms but one isn't as bad as the other. Any suggestions on what it could be? Thank You, Bernice
Posts.Title: Lump under arm

Posts.Content: Thank you for your reply. If it was lymph nodes, wouldn't my doctor be able to tell that? She told me that she doesn't think it was anything to worry about but she wants me to see a specialist to confirm it. But I'm still worried about it. Would a mammogram show the area under the arm? Bernice
Posts.Title: Lump under arm

Posts.Content: >>I too, have a lump like you describe under my right arm pit only<< I have them in both armpits but one is more felt than the other. Please let me know how you make out and what yours are. Are fatty cyst/tumors serious? Thank you, Bernice
Posts.Title: Lump under arm

Posts.Content: >>I too, have a lump like you describe under my right arm pit only. I am going in for a diagnostic Mammogram and ultrasound on June 1st.<< Did you get the results back from your mammogram and ultrasound yet? I'm going to the specialist tomorrow and he's going to do an ultrasound. I'm a nervous wreck. I hope everything is alright. Bernice
Posts.Title: Lump under arm

Posts.Content: >>My dr. told me most likely nothing to worry about. I asked if it was a lymph node and she didn't think so, but said it was most likely a fatty cyst or tumor<< Are fatty cysts/tumors long like a muscle and when you press on it, you can feel it as you move your fingers along your armpit? Or are they round lumps (which isn't what I feel)? Bernice
Posts.Title: Lump under arm

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by shisslak Bernice How did everything go today?? Brenda Thanks for asking. I had another mammogram and an ultrasound today. She told me I had a cyst and to get another mammogram in 6 months. I picked up the report from the hospital (I know I shouldn't do that) but it made me nervous again. Here's what it says. Findings: Ultrasound reveals 3 small cysts in the medial tissues of the left breast, one in the upper quadrant, one in the mid portion, and one in the lower quadrant. These appear benigh, although the margins of the upper and mid breast cysts are a bit irregular with poosible septations. These are all small measuring about 3-4 mm in size. No focal solid lesions are demonstrated sonographically. Impression: Three tiny cysts in the medial tissues of the left breast. At least one of these most likely accounts for the new density seen there on the resent mammograms. Because of the irregular cyst contours and possible septations in 2 of these cysts, 6-month surveillance sonography and mammograms of the left breast are recommended. Do you know what septation means? Why wouldn't they want me to come back sooner? Bernice
Posts.Title: Mammogram

Posts.Content: What would an ultrasound detect? Fatty tissue? A muscle? I'm going to call my doctor and ask he if we can do that first (or in the meantime while waiting for my insurance company to approve a specialist and then it might take awhile to get in to see them). Bernice
Posts.Title: Lump under arm

Posts.Content: On 5/29/10 I had a yearly mammogram. I'm 46 years old and all my mammograms came back normal. I picked up the report for this mammogram and I'm a nervous wreck. This is what it says: Findings: Dense and hetergenous breast parenchyma is again observed with minor asymmetry. Allowing for some differences of technique and positioning, there is an apparent new 7 mm irregular density in the medial tissues of the left breast seen on the craniocaudal view. This cannot be identified on previous exams. Repeat craniocaudal view as well as spot compression views are advised to see if this persists. No pathologic calcifications. Impression: New 7 mm density medially in left breast which needs further imaging evalution as discussed above. Does anyone know what this means? I called my doctor who hasn't called me back yet. In October 2009, I had a hysterectomy with both ovaries removed and been on the patch (vivelle-dot) since my hysterectomy. I'm on the lowest dose .05. Could this patch have something to do with this? Isn't 7 mm big? Any information will be appreciated. Thank you Bernice
Posts.Title: Mammogram

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by shisslak Bernice, What the report is saying is that when reviewing the old films this 7mm density was not present. It also mentions that it can only be seen on one view. The need for the repeat is to tell if this new finding is real or an artifact on the film. The radiologist wants the one view repeated to see if the density is still there and the spot film is to cone down to the area and compress it to see if they can identify it. Do not be surprised if they also request an ultrasound of the area, this will let them know if the density is solid or liquid. Good luck with the repeat exam and let me know how you do. Brenda Thank you for your reply. What is a "density"? Is it a mass? I'm going back tomorrow for another mammogram. The radiologist will look at it there and if they see anything, they'll do an ultrasound. I'm a nervous wreck especially if they want to do an ultrasound. Bernice
Posts.Title: Mammogram

Posts.Content: I went and had my repeat mammogram today. They said it was glandular breast tissue or top of tissue. What a relief. Thank you all for responding and help ease my mind a little.
Posts.Title: Dense Breast

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by shisslak Density is just an extra thickness unlike any other tissue that they can see on the Mammogram. Unless the Radiologist is 100 percent certain that everything is alright, they will do the ultrasound. They do this because of liability--afraid that some top notch attorney will put them on the stand and say "well why did you not do the ultrasound 4 years ago". Having an ultrasound is far better than sticking a needle in to find out the density is only fluid. I understand you are nervous--I have been in that situation numerous times, and it does not get any easier. I will be thinking of you tomorrow--let me know how everything turns out. Brenda Thank you. I will. Bernice
Posts.Title: Mammogram

Posts.Content: On Tuesday, I had my yearly mammogram. My doctor's office called me today and told me that I have really dense breasts and there's one area in my right breast that they can't see clearly and they want me to go back on Monday for another mammogram. I am freaking out. They do not state that there is a mass, tumor or anything else there. They just want to take a better look and make sure it's nothing. What do you think? Has anybody gotten a call that they had to go back for another mammogram and it was nothing?
Posts.Title: Dense Breast

Posts.Content: Thank you all for your replies. I am still nervous but I won't be completely relieved until the radiologist says it's nothing. I wonder if we who have dense breasts should get mammograms twice a year and maybe even ultrasounds? A few years ago they did see 3 little cysts, I had to go back for an ultrasound and had a mammogram every 3 or 4 months for a year....now the cysts aren't there. My doctor's office did tell me that the radiologist did not see any mass, tumor or anything else like that. They said that my breast tissue is kind of clumped together and they want to take a closer look at it and make sure it's nothing. But I'm still freaking out about it.
Posts.Title: Dense Breast
